Description: Case of wooden anthropoid coffin of Inpehefnakht; painted detail on plaster including Hieroglyphic text; foot-board lost.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: PM I Part 2: p.638 G. Pinch, Magic in Ancient Egypt (London 1994), fig.86. Other objects from the burial of Inpehefnakht include two shabtis inscribed with his name and title: Boston MFA 72.1747 and 72.1751. Another shabti with the same name, but no title, was in the possession of Martin Churchill of Seven Oaks, Kent, in 2006.
Bibliographic references: Taylor 2010 / Journey through the afterlife: Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead (fig. 11, fig. 26; no. 92)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2010 4th Nov-2011 6th March, Round Reading Room BM, Book of the Dead
